result.execSummary:
The defendant Marlon Londell Winston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality Repeater, Mandatory Minimum - Repeat Firearm Crimes], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Court allows early termination of probation if the defendant completes all conditions of probation

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample. Pay a fine in the amount of $500.00. Court ordered the defendant to pay the fine plus all court costs, fees and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marlon Londell Winston

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Marlon Londell Winston in court.  Attorney Robert E Webb Jr in court for Marlon Londell Winston.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for jury trial.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties. 

AS TO COUNT 1: 
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  Sentencing proceeded. 
Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served.  The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 1 YEAR. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- Provide DNA sample.
- Complete 40 hours of community service. 
- Pay a fine in the amount of $500.

*Court allows early termination of probation if the defendant completes all conditions of probation.

Court ordered the defendant to pay the fine plus all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

20 day appeal rights given.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Marlon Londell Winston appeared by video.  Attorney Robert E Webb Jr in court for Marlon Londell Winston.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for final pretrial.  Jury trial remains scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed:  Defendant's Motion in Limine.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Supervision Report 08-30-2022
Received and Filed: Pretrial Supervision Report 08-23-2022
Court rescheduled final pretrial upon request from the defense.  Parties notified of new date.  Final pretrial scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 1:30 pm.
Received and Filed:  Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence at Trial
Received and Filed:  State's Motion in Limine
Received and Filed.

Defendant Marlon Londell Winston in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM. Case in court for Scheduling Conference.  Court set final pretrial and jury trial dates upon request from the defense.  Defense acknowledges receipt of discovery.  Court ordered all substantive motions to be filed by 6-17-2022 and all responses to be filed by 7-15-2022 or they will be deemed waived.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Supervision Report 05-20-2022

Defendant Marlon Londell Winston in court with Attorney Robert E Webb; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Status Report 03-24-2022

Cash bail previously posted to be returned to the remitter.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT for supervision. Defendant to report to JUSTICE POINT LEVEL 3 immediately upon leaving court. 
IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

ADDRESS INFO for Marlon Londell Winston
Current: 6027 W Calumet Road, Milwaukee, WI 53223   (Effective: 03-14-2022)
Prior: 9745 West Beatrice Street, Milwaukee, WI 53224
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Marlon Londell Winston in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Marlon Londell Winston not in court.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/4/22 @ 2p
